entry.title: Karabakh: One Year After the War

media:group.media:title: Karabakh: One Year After the War
media:group.media:description:
One year after the start of the Second Karabakh War on September 27, 2020, Armenia, Artsakh and Azerbaijan remember the thousands that lost their lives fighting. As the dust of the war settles, CivilNet looks back on that day that shook the foundations of the region.

TK & Partners ีญีธึีฐึีคีกีฟีพีกีฏีกีถ ีจีถีฏีฅึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฏีกีผีกีพีกึีธีฒ ีฃีธึีฎีจีถีฏีฅึ, ิถีซีถีฎีกีผีกีตีธีฒีถีฅึีซ ีกีบีกีฐีธีพีกีฃึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีซีดีถีกีคึีกีดีซ ีถีกีญีฏีซีถ ีฟีถึ ึีฅีถ ีีกึีธึีชีกีถ ิฑีพีฅีฟีซึีตีกีถีจ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ิฑึีทีกีฌีธึีตีฝ ีีฒีคีฅีฝีตีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด ีญีธีฝีฅีฌ ีง ีีกึีกีขีกีฒีตีกีถ ีฅึีฏึีธึีค ีบีกีฟีฅึีกีฆีดีซ ีฟีกึีฅีฌีซึีซ, ีฆีซีถีฎีกีผีกีตีธีฒีถีฅึีซ ีจีถีฟีกีถีซึีถีฅึีซีถ ีฐีกีฟีฏีกึีพีกีฎ ีฐีกีฟีธึึีธึีดีถีฅึีซ ีธึ ีบีฅีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีพีฅึีกีฏีกีถีฃีถีดีกีถ ีถีฅึีธึีชีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ:

media:group.media:description:
ยซีีกีพีกีฏยป ีฅึีฅีญีกีตีซ ึ ีจีถีฟีกีถีซึีซ ีฆีกึีฃีกึีดีกีถี ิฑีฌีกีพีฅึีคีซีซ ีฐีกีดีกีตีถึีกีตีซีถ ีฏีฅีถีฟึีธีถีจ ีฎีกีผีกีตีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึ ีง ีดีกีฟีธึึีธึีด ีฐีกีดีกีตีถึีซ 125 ีฅึีฅีญีกีถีฅึีซ, ีกีตีค ีฉีพีธึีดี 17 ีฐีกีทีดีกีถีคีกีดีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ีธึีถีฅึีธีฒีซึ ยซีีกีพีกีฏีจยป ีขีกึีพีฅีฌ ีง 2020ีฉโคี ยซีีธึีฌีค ีีซีชีถ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถยป ีฏีกีฆีดีกีฏีฅึีบีธึีฉีตีกีถ ึีซีถีกีถีฝีกีพีธึีดีกีดีข ึ ีฏีกีผีกีพีกึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีคึีกีดีกีทีถีธึีฐีกีตีซีถ ีฎึีกีฃึีธีพ: ิฟีฅีถีฟึีธีถีจ ีฝีธึีซีกีฌีกีฏีกีถ ีฎีกีผีกีตีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึ ีง ีดีกีฟีธึึีธึีด ีฝีธึีซีกีฌีกีบีฅีฝ ีกีถีกีบีกีฐีธีพ ีจีถีฟีกีถีซึีถีฅึีซีถ: ิฑีตีฝีฟีฅีฒ ีฃีธึีฎีธึีด ีฅีถ ีถีกึ ีฅึีฅีญีกีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีถีกีฃีซีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีธีฒีดีถีธึีธีทีดีกีถ ึ ีดีฅีคีซีกีฃึีกีฃีซีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีญีดีขีกีฏีถีฅึ:

ิฟีกึีซีถีฅ ีีธึึีกีคีตีกีถีจ ีีกีฐีฅีซ ีดีกีตึีถ ีง: ีีกีฝีถีธึีฉีกีดีตีก ีีกีฐีฅีถ ีฆีธีฐีพีฅึ 2020 ีฉีพีกีฏีกีถีซ ีีกึีกีขีกีฒีตีกีถ ีบีกีฟีฅึีกีฆีดีธึีดึ ีีกีฟีฅึีกีฆีดีซึ ีฐีฅีฟีธ ีฏีธึีฝีฟีซ ีพีซีทีฟีจ, ึีกีพีถ ีธึ ีฟีญึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีธึีคีฅีฏีธึีธึีตีฝ ีกีตีฌ ีดีกีตึีฅึีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฏีซีฝีฅีฌีธึ ีฐีกีดีกึ ิฟีกึีซีถีฅีถ ีฝีฟีฅีฒีฎีฅีฌ ีง ยซีีกีพีฅึีชยป-ีจี ีฏีกีฆีดีกีฏีฅึีบีธึีฉีตีธึีถ, ีธึีซ ีดีซีปีธึีธีพ ีดีกีตึีฅึีจ ีฝึีธึีธึีด ีฅีถ ีดีซีดีตีกีถึ, ีดีซีกีฝีซีถ ีกึีฟีกีฝีพีธึีด ีฅีถ, ีดีซีกีฝีซีถ ีฐีซีทีธึีด, ีดีซีกีฝีซีถ ีฆีกีตึีกีถีธึีด ึ ีฅึีขีฅีดีถ ีดีซีกีฝีซีถ ีฎีซีฎีกีฒีธึีด: ิฟีกีฆีดีกีฏีฅึีบีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีดีซีกีพีธึีฅีฌ ีง ีดีธีฟ ีฐีกึีตีธึึ ีดีกีตึีฅึีซึ ยซีีกีพีธึ, ีฉีซีพีจ ีชีกีดีกีถีกีฏีซ ีจีถีฉีกึึีธึีด ีกีพีฅีฌีกีถีธึีด ีงยป, - ีกีฝีธึีด ีง ิฟีกึีซีถีฅีถ:
Karine Muradyan is Vaheโs mother. Eighteen year old Vahe died while fighting the 2020 Karabakh War. To be able to share the grief, pain and sadness of this loss with other mothers who experienced such loss, Karine created โHaverjโ (Eternal) - an organization through which mothers find comfort with one another. They cry together, remember together, get angry together and, at times, laugh together. There are roughly one hundred mothers in the organization and โunfortunately the number is increasing through time,โ says Karine.

entry.title: Lessons we learned from the 2020 Karabakh War

media:group.media:title: Lessons we learned from the 2020 Karabakh War
media:group.media:description:
In the latest edition of Insights with Eric Hacopian, Eric discusses the lessons Armenia and Armenians learned from last yearโs 44-day war. Eric explains why the actions of Azerbaijan and Turkey were fascistic, racist and immoral in their intent and why Armenia now must develop economically to overcome this environment.

entry.title: A New Rehabilitation City for War Heroes

media:group.media:title: A New Rehabilitation City for War Heroes
media:group.media:description:
A rehab center called "Rehabilitation City of Heroes" is being built in the Proshyan community near Yerevan. It will be the first of its kind in Armeniaโค The projectโs goal is to carry out psychological, intellectual and social rehabilitation treatments for wounded soldiers and war survivors in general.
Suren Areents is the author of the project and he believes that physical wounds are not the deepest ones that soldiers experience.

entry.title: โWe have to do everything to ensure that the new generation succeedsโ, Marie Lou Papazian

media:group.media:title: โWe have to do everything to ensure that the new generation succeedsโ, Marie Lou Papazian
media:group.media:description:
Marie Lou Papazian, in conversation with Lara Tcholakian, speaks about her source of energy and optimism, as well as her sense of perseverance and grit. She touches upon the memories of her family history and family narratives, and how her grandparents helped shape her successful journey. She reflects on the perspectives required for a viable Armenia and Artsakh, and shares her vision for a hopeful future for Armeniaโs children.
About Marie Lou Papazian Marie Lou Papazian is TUMOโs founding CEO. As an engineer and education specialist, she has led the Education for Development Foundation linking Armenian students to their global peers through online educational activities. Previously, she was lead construction manager on prominent high-rise buildings in New York City. Marie Lou holds a Masterโs Degree in Computing in Education from the Teachers College at Columbia University and is a graduate of Harvard Business Schoolโs General Management Program. In 2019, she received the Ordre des Palmes acadรฉmiques โ a national order bestowed by the French Republic on distinguished academics and figures in the world of culture and education.
Program overview Armenian leaders share inherited cultural and historical narratives, memories, life learnings and experiences. Down-to-earth, authentic and mindful conversations preserve the stories and legacies of families, and reflect on the lessons learnt from inherited collective trauma and introspective leadership.

๐ิดีฅีบีซ ีีกึีฟีกีฏีฅึีฟ ีถีธึ ีณีกีถีกีบีกึีฐีซ ีทีซีถีกึีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถ ีจีถีฉีกึึีซ ีดีฅีป ีงึ ๐ีีธีพีฝีฅึีกีพีกีถีธึีด ีถีธึ ีฉีกีฒีกีดีกีฝ ีง ีฏีกีผีธึึีพีธึีดี 77 ีกีผีกีถีฑีถีกีฟีถีธีพึ ๐ยซีีกีทีซึ ีฃึีธึีบยป-ีจ ิฑึึีกีญีซ ีขีกึีฅีฏีฅึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกึ 50 ีดีซีฌีซีธีถ ีคีธีฌีกึ ีฏีฐีกีฟีฏีกึีถีซึ ๐ิฑึึีกีญีซ ีถีฅึีคึีธึีดีกีตีซีถ ีฐีซีดีถีกีคึีกีดีจ ีฐึีกีชีกึีพีธึีด ีง ีขีกึีกีฐีกีตีฟีฅีฌี ีธึีด ีง ีกีปีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ีฟึีกีดีกีคึีฅีฌึ ๐ีีกึีฟีกีฏีฅึีฟีซ ีีกึีถีฏีกีฉีกีฒ ีฐีกีดีกีตีถึีธึีด ีบีกีบีกีฏีกีถ ีฟีธึีถีจ ีคีบึีธึ ีง ีคีกึีฑีฅีฌึ
